Extract model coefficients

Source: R/PLNfit-S3methods.R
coef.PLNfit.Rd

Extracts model coefficients from objects returned by PLN() and its variants

# S3 method for PLNfit
coef(object, type = c("main", "covariance"), ...)

Arguments

object

an R6 object with class PLNfit
type

type of parameter that should be extracted. Either "main" (default) for $$\Theta$$ or "covariance" for $$\Sigma$$
...

additional parameters for S3 compatibility. Not used

Value

A matrix of coefficients extracted from the PLNfit model.

See also

sigma.PLNfit(), vcov.PLNfit(), standard_error.PLNfit()

Examples

data(trichoptera)
trichoptera <- prepare_data(trichoptera$Abundance, trichoptera$Covariate)
myPLN <- PLN(Abundance ~ 1 + offset(log(Offset)), data = trichoptera)

#> 
#>  Initialization...
#>  Adjusting a PLN model with full covariance model
#>  Post-treatments...
#>  DONE!
coef(myPLN) ## Theta

#>     (Intercept)
#> Che  -8.1764950
#> Hyc  -8.2813683
#> Hym  -2.9781367
#> Hys  -7.0837271
#> Psy  -0.5445265
#> Aga  -4.0837877
#> Glo  -6.3380234
#> Ath  -6.0428473
#> Cea  -7.1003652
#> Ced  -3.6370568
#> Set  -4.4037748
#> All  -4.9194492
#> Han  -4.8160861
#> Hfo  -6.1372172
#> Hsp  -4.2451606
#> Hve  -6.8466662
#> Sta  -2.8842240
coef(myPLN, type = "covariance") ## Sigma
